More often than not, the number of cores / threads a game utilizes squeezes out major diminishing returns.

Supreme Commander is a great example of a game that relies majority on single thread performance rather than multi-thread performance, and it, too, improves gameplay when you have more cores and threads per processor.
It's not efficient at it, of course, but that's exactly why it's a great example.
